item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair. Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "In this part of the story I am the one who dies, the only one, and I will die of love because I love you, because I love you, Love, in fire and in blood." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "It was at that age that poetry came in search of me." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Alexandra add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "If I had thought the beef marrow might be a hell of a lot of work for not much difference, I needn’t have worried. The taste of the marrow is rich, meaty, intense in a nearly-too-much way. In my increasingly depraved state, I could think of nothing at first but that it tasted like really good sex. But there was something more than that, even. What it really tastes like is life, well lived. Of course the cow I got marrow from had a fairly crappy life – lots of crowds and overmedication and bland food that might or might not have been a relative. But deep in his or her bones, there was a capacity for feral joy. I could taste it." -- Julie Powell
